name: undischarged
content:
undischarged adjective
(DEBT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a debt is undischarged, it has not been paid back completely: These contributions are an undischarged loan to the government.
More examplesFewer examplesTitle insurance is becoming increasingly common, and it covers survey issues and undischarged mortgages relating to previous owners.The interest which may be payable on the sum remains undischarged.

undischarged adjective
(GUN)
If a gun is undischarged, it has not yet been fired: We found a loaded and undischarged handgun in his coat pocket. The pistol was undischarged and still cocked.
More examplesFewer examplesHe bent down to secure his undischarged gun.One load remained in the pistol undischarged.I approached slowly, undischarged gun in my hand.

undischarged adjective
(EMOTION)
If an emotion is undischarged, it has not been expressed or released: Undischarged emotion can be expressed through songs and music. He was left with the feeling of emotions undischarged, of a process uncompleted.
More examplesFewer examplesUndischarged feeling creates a tense mind, and emotion can be expressed in one of two ways — by action or speech.She was left, undischarged, the heat burning inside her chest.He was rendered unable to speak by some undischarged feeling.

undischarged adjective
(DUTY)
If something you must do is undischarged, it has not been done. : She had an uneasy sense of undischarged responsibility. The court ordered that the sentence be served consecutive to any previously imposed undischarged prison term.
More examplesFewer examplesLive your life so that no man holds against you any undischarged obligation.Later governments inherited undischarged duties to repair the wrongs of the former regime.At some time or other, everyone has experienced the sense of undischarged responsibility that results from having left a task undone.
